title: Pope Leo VIII is appointed to the office of Protonotary and begins his papacy as antipope of Rome.
text: Pope Leo VIII is appointed to the office of Protonotary and begins his papacy as antipope of Rome.

title: Béla I is crowned king of Hungary.
text: Béla I is crowned king of Hungary.

title: Mongol invasion of Rus': Kiev under Daniel of Galicia and Voivode Dmytro falls to the Mongols under Batu Khan.
text: Mongol invasion of Rus': Kiev under Daniel of Galicia and Voivode Dmytro falls to the Mongols under Batu Khan.

title: The city of Quito in Ecuador is founded by Spanish settlers led by Sebastián de Belalcázar.
text: The city of Quito in Ecuador is founded by Spanish settlers led by Sebastián de Belalcázar.

title: Colonel Thomas Pride of the New Model Army purges the Long Parliament of MPs sympathetic to King Charles I of England, in order for the King's trial to go ahead; came to be known as "Pride's Purge".
text: Colonel Thomas Pride of the New Model Army purges the Long Parliament of MPs sympathetic to King Charles I of England, in order for the King's trial to go ahead; came to be known as "Pride's Purge".

title: Battle of Chamkaur: During the Mughal-Sikh Wars, an outnumbered Sikh Khalsa defeats a Mughal army.
text: Battle of Chamkaur: During the Mughal-Sikh Wars, an outnumbered Sikh Khalsa defeats a Mughal army.

title: Charles Edward Stuart's army begins retreat during the second Jacobite Rising.
text: Charles Edward Stuart's army begins retreat during the second Jacobite Rising.

title: The first edition of the Encyclopædia Britannica is published.
text: The first edition of the Encyclopædia Britannica is published.

title: The U.S. Congress moves from New York City to Philadelphia.
text: The U.S. Congress moves from New York City to Philadelphia.

title: Georgia ratifies 13th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution[1]
text: Georgia ratifies 13th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution[1]

title: The first edition of The Washington Post is published.
text: The first edition of The Washington Post is published.

title: The Washington Monument in Washington, D.C., is completed.
text: The Washington Monument in Washington, D.C., is completed.

title: London becomes the world's first city to host licensed taxicabs.
text: London becomes the world's first city to host licensed taxicabs.

title: Theodore Roosevelt articulated his "Corollary" to the Monroe Doctrine, stating that the U.S. would intervene in the Western Hemisphere should Latin American governments prove incapable or unstable.
text: Theodore Roosevelt articulated his "Corollary" to the Monroe Doctrine, stating that the U.S. would intervene in the Western Hemisphere should Latin American governments prove incapable or unstable.

title: A coal mine explosion at Monongah, West Virginia, kills 362 workers.
text: A coal mine explosion at Monongah, West Virginia, kills 362 workers.

title: The Nefertiti Bust is discovered.
text: The Nefertiti Bust is discovered.

title: World War I: The Central Powers capture Bucharest.
text: World War I: The Central Powers capture Bucharest.

title: Finland declares independence from Russia.
text: Finland declares independence from Russia.

title: Halifax Explosion: A munitions explosion near Halifax, Nova Scotia kills more than 1,900 people in the largest artificial explosion up to that time.
text: Halifax Explosion: A munitions explosion near Halifax, Nova Scotia kills more than 1,900 people in the largest artificial explosion up to that time.

title: World War I: USS Jacob Jones is the first American destroyer to be sunk by enemy action when it is torpedoed by German submarine SM U-53.
text: World War I: USS Jacob Jones is the first American destroyer to be sunk by enemy action when it is torpedoed by German submarine SM U-53.

title: The Anglo-Irish Treaty is signed in London by British and Irish representatives.
text: The Anglo-Irish Treaty is signed in London by British and Irish representatives.

title: One year to the day after the signing of the Anglo-Irish Treaty, the Irish Free State comes into existence.
text: One year to the day after the signing of the Anglo-Irish Treaty, the Irish Free State comes into existence.

title: The government of Colombia sends military forces to suppress a month-long strike by United Fruit Company workers, resulting in an unknown number of deaths.
text: The government of Colombia sends military forces to suppress a month-long strike by United Fruit Company workers, resulting in an unknown number of deaths.

title: U.S. federal judge John M. Woolsey rules that James Joyce's novel Ulysses is not obscene.
text: U.S. federal judge John M. Woolsey rules that James Joyce's novel Ulysses is not obscene.

title: World War II: The United Kingdom and Canada declare war on Finland in support of the Soviet Union during the Continuation War. Camp X opens in Canada to begin training Allied Secret Agents for the War.
text: World War II: The United Kingdom and Canada declare war on Finland in support of the Soviet Union during the Continuation War. Camp X opens in Canada to begin training Allied Secret Agents for the War.

title: The Everglades National Park in Florida is dedicated.
text: The Everglades National Park in Florida is dedicated.

title: Vladimir Nabokov completes his controversial novel Lolita.
text: Vladimir Nabokov completes his controversial novel Lolita.

title: A violent water polo match between Hungary and the USSR takes place during the 1956 Summer Olympics in Melbourne, against the backdrop of the Hungarian Revolution of 1956.
text: A violent water polo match between Hungary and the USSR takes place during the 1956 Summer Olympics in Melbourne, against the backdrop of the Hungarian Revolution of 1956.

title: Project Vanguard: A launchpad explosion of Vanguard TV3 thwarts the first United States attempt to launch a satellite into Earth orbit.
text: Project Vanguard: A launchpad explosion of Vanguard TV3 thwarts the first United States attempt to launch a satellite into Earth orbit.

title: Adrian Kantrowitz performs the first human heart transplant in the United States.
text: Adrian Kantrowitz performs the first human heart transplant in the United States.

title: Altamont Free Concert: At a free concert performed by the Rolling Stones, eighteen-year old Meredith Hunter is beaten to death by Hells Angels security guards.
text: Altamont Free Concert: At a free concert performed by the Rolling Stones, eighteen-year old Meredith Hunter is beaten to death by Hells Angels security guards.

title: Pakistan severs diplomatic relations with India, initiating the Indo-Pakistani War of 1971.
text: Pakistan severs diplomatic relations with India, initiating the Indo-Pakistani War of 1971.

title: The Twenty-fifth Amendment: The United States House of Representatives votes 387 to 35 to confirm Gerald Ford as Vice President of the United States. (On November 27, the Senate confirmed him 92 to 3.)
text: The Twenty-fifth Amendment: The United States House of Representatives votes 387 to 35 to confirm Gerald Ford as Vice President of the United States. (On November 27, the Senate confirmed him 92 to 3.)

title: The Troubles: Fleeing from the police, a Provisional IRA unit takes a British couple hostage in their flat on Balcombe Street, London, beginning a six-day siege.
text: The Troubles: Fleeing from the police, a Provisional IRA unit takes a British couple hostage in their flat on Balcombe Street, London, beginning a six-day siege.

title: South Africa grants independence to Bophuthatswana, although it is not recognized by any other country.
text: South Africa grants independence to Bophuthatswana, although it is not recognized by any other country.

title: Spain ratifies the Spanish Constitution of 1978 in a referendum.
text: Spain ratifies the Spanish Constitution of 1978 in a referendum.

title: The Troubles: The Irish National Liberation Army bombs a pub frequented by British soldiers in Ballykelly, Northern Ireland, killing eleven soldiers and six civilians.
text: The Troubles: The Irish National Liberation Army bombs a pub frequented by British soldiers in Ballykelly, Northern Ireland, killing eleven soldiers and six civilians.

title: The École Polytechnique massacre (or Montreal Massacre): Marc Lépine, an anti-feminist gunman, murders 14 young women at the École Polytechnique in Montreal.
text: The École Polytechnique massacre (or Montreal Massacre): Marc Lépine, an anti-feminist gunman, murders 14 young women at the École Polytechnique in Montreal.

title: Yugoslav Wars: In Croatia, forces of the Yugoslav People's Army (JNA) bombard Dubrovnik after laying siege to the city for seven months.
text: Yugoslav Wars: In Croatia, forces of the Yugoslav People's Army (JNA) bombard Dubrovnik after laying siege to the city for seven months.

title: The Babri Masjid in Ayodhya, India, is demolished, leading to widespread riots causing the death of over 1,500 people.
text: The Babri Masjid in Ayodhya, India, is demolished, leading to widespread riots causing the death of over 1,500 people.

title: A Russian Antonov An-124 Ruslan cargo plane crashes into an apartment complex near Irkutsk, Siberia, killing 67.
text: A Russian Antonov An-124 Ruslan cargo plane crashes into an apartment complex near Irkutsk, Siberia, killing 67.

title: in Venezuela, Hugo Chávez is victorious in presidential elections.
text: in Venezuela, Hugo Chávez is victorious in presidential elections.

title: An Iranian Air Force C-130 military transport aircraft crashes into a ten-floor apartment building in a residential area of Tehran, killing all 84 on board and 44 more on the ground.
text: An Iranian Air Force C-130 military transport aircraft crashes into a ten-floor apartment building in a residential area of Tehran, killing all 84 on board and 44 more on the ground.

title: NASA reveals photographs taken by Mars Global Surveyor suggesting the presence of liquid water on Mars.
text: NASA reveals photographs taken by Mars Global Surveyor suggesting the presence of liquid water on Mars.

title: Venezuelan elections are held. For the first time in 17 years the United Socialist Party of Venezuela loses its majority in parliament.
text: Venezuelan elections are held. For the first time in 17 years the United Socialist Party of Venezuela loses its majority in parliament.

title: Donald Trump's administration officially announces the recognition of Jerusalem as capital of Israel.
text: Donald Trump's administration officially announces the recognition of Jerusalem as capital of Israel.
